DOC.brief_title: A School-Based HIV/STD Prevention Program Reduce Risky Sexual Behaviors Among Adolescents Liberia
DOC.detailed_description: Currently , 60 million people diagnosed HIV/AIDS worldwide . It estimate two-thirds HIV infection among people Africa . The African country Liberia , particular , experience increase HIV/sexually transmit disease ( STD ) infection need improve HIV/STD-related prevention program . With majority new infection occur among people 15 29 year old , new HIV/STD prevention program need educate youth proper condom use risk associate sexual behavior . Previous research suggest behavioral intervention reduce adolescent ' sexual behavior tie risk acquire STDs . The evidenced-based HIV prevention program , Making Proud Choices , intervention originally design community setting United States , currently adapt school certain sub-Saharan African country . Adapting community-based curriculum school-based setting cultural context within Liberia may effective reduce risky sexual behavior Liberian adolescent . This study compare effectiveness school-based HIV/STD prevention program draw curriculum Making Proud Choices versus general health promotion program reduce sexual risk behavior youth attend school Liberia . Participation study involve two phase . Phase 1 last 8 month use adapt community-based curriculum Making Proud Choices school-based setting context within Liberia . Data guide integration cultural adaptation curriculum collect school administrator , student , health educator , community-based organization focus group , group discussion , interview . Phase 2 last 12 month include junior high school Liberia . Participating school assign randomly provide adapt HIV prevention curriculum general health promotion curriculum . Before start course module , student receive either curriculum complete questionnaire risk-associated sexual behavior knowledge condom use abstinence . Both curriculum include eight 1-hour module deliver weekly 8 week . The HIV prevention curriculum focus increase knowledge prevent HIV , STDs , pregnancy ; improve condom use skill ; increase confidence ability negotiate safer sex use condom correctly ; lower incidence sexual-risk behavior . The general health promotion curriculum focus teach student healthful behavior , include eat habit , physical activity , dental hygiene , avoidance cigarette smoke substance abuse . All participant repeat initial questionnaire immediately complete curriculum 3 , 6 , 9 month curriculum end .
